documents.document: Always good to do a blog post, just to remind myself that, Yes, I still can do typos in the first sentence
@AGFchairman that as well.
@dootsiez I watched the 1 set on TV, then after the 2nd I switched to my ipad. Had to do something to change the momentum!
@argumentalist I am not going to keep going to Double Fantasy!
@AGFchairman yes, that is a good comparison.
@DamienCWalker 22 likes can't be wrong!!
@lucykateclark @Paul_Karp look, I am getting far too much heat for this! It is prime-Dad joke material. Gold class!
@MarkDiStef oh come on! I thought it was good!
So much in denial he might as well be sailing in a felucca https://t.co/rjYjnT01bV
Yeah why would you let the Australian public know https://t.co/jiblDMRI73
Well let's just hope the assurances filter down through the well oiled system that is the US Govt at the moment... https://t.co/Q4l82OifeL
Be fierce, furious, and fight! Join the Raccoons of the Resistance! | First Dog on the Moon https://t.co/awXGkbX41J
Spiking prices are good news for the budget - but will they last (& if only we had some sort of minerals tax...). M… https://t.co/gk8IFinjRN

@AdeleLausberg yeah, just was out watering the garden. Not pleasant
@bernietb the pivot will happen any day now
It's neck and neck, but Canberra with the win. #itisabithotfor8pm https://t.co/ehOlBi5FzA

@SP_luke @DirtyDowling definately showing signs of promise for the future
@NeilMcMahon it was a bit drunken aunt at a 21st
One of these things is not like the other.. #ausvnz https://t.co/4nivvw2s3f
@NeilMcMahon just realised that has Dolly as well

@NeilMcMahon no doubt they'll find some "balance" soon
Lily Tomlin giving a great speech at the SAG Awards
@jackson_mac yeah that was my first memory as well
@NeilMcMahon you seeing Dolly Parton at the SAG Awards?
@SamEBJones here's the updated one https://t.co/fJ0fkdDQAq
Scott Morrison says Trump travel ban shows 'world is catching up' to Australia https://t.co/YEo9OwgO7H
As a few have noted to me - LL Cool J's - G.O.A.T. in 2000 was probably when
@gregreedee if you read the real early ones, they are amazingly cruel.
@Watsonian_ chers - I remember Maurice Greene using it around that time as well, so that would fit
@MicWink my earliest recollection was Maurice Greene getting a G.O.A.T. tattoo
@illywhacker_ So my list is, Penny-farthing, a 1970s Dragster, a 10 speed my mate had in Year 7, a BMX and... yeah that'd be it.
@Mrmsutton Peanuts comics are bitter, sad things about how life knocks you down repeatedly
@illywhacker_ !!!! roflol
Anyone know when GOAT went from meaning a loser in sports to meaning "Greatest of All-time"? https://t.co/LevukemN72
@RyanBuckland7 if Number 1 gets done, does number 2 need to occur?
#notTheOnion "Trump Hosts First Movie Screening in White House Theater - FINDING DORY" https://t.co/1Yt3a7HkIy via @thr
@marcuskelson @NeilMcMahon @AttardMon 5th set is just about all you need.
@NeilMcMahon @marcuskelson @AttardMon with the label for the black line! https://t.co/GLNjydnmXt
@marcuskelson @NeilMcMahon @AttardMon and the slam career graph updated https://t.co/8u9MPsu2uO
@NeilMcMahon @AttardMon The updated graph https://t.co/rDHmXRArzZ
@NeilMcMahon @swearyanthony no way Serena retires until she has 25
@NeilMcMahon @swearyanthony for the first time, you feel like Fed is seeing the end. But he loves the sport so much, so why not play on?
@swearyanthony @NeilMcMahon my gut feeling is 2018 might be the farewell tour for both
@swearyanthony @NeilMcMahon yeah Graf was amazing (and my fav) The Seles attack is always a bit of an asterisk - not her fault though
@swearyanthony @NeilMcMahon only lost to him twice in slams iirc. Roddick was the big loser from having Federer around
@NeilMcMahon @swearyanthony for me, the thing with Serena is, when was the last tournament she was not the favourite?
@swearyanthony @NeilMcMahon Nadal not so much - he's as close to equal with Fed as it gets, and I'd say they make each other better
"And for the public watching, it’s entirely reasonable to choose a favorite but to like the other guy as well." https://t.co/wQEcFQs8cv
@swearyanthony @NeilMcMahon that the two came along at the same time is amazing
And with that win, Federer rises to Number 10 in the world... #AusOpen
@russellmahoney it is one of the best non-fiction books I've ever read.
Ahh someone just read the NY Times editorial to the orange bloviator in chief https://t.co/fxNNm2ofss
@russellmahoney have you read Richard Rhodes "Making of the Atomic Bomb"?
@khalllaw yep, but Rafa's always been the kryptonite.
@NeilMcMahon @Kimbo_Ramplin @AttardMon @DblRistretto @JenBrockie Dimitrov and Zverev the younger
@cappertowers so they have an online thing like ABC?
@upulie @DamienCWalker there's a queue folks, get in line!
@Kimbo_Ramplin he ain't alone there!
Rafa is a champion. Great speech #AusOpen
@lucasgarth @ChrisKaias get to the quarters and he's always a chance
Federer might be the best, but tournaments without Rafa always feel empty. Great to have him back playing great #AusOpen
@Kimbo_Ramplin @AttardMon @JenBrockie @NeilMcMahon yep, he's a champion at all times. One of the most gracious players ever
FWIW given his draw and the time off, and because he had to beat Rafa, I think this is his best slam victory #AusOpen
@Kimbo_Ramplin @AttardMon @JenBrockie @NeilMcMahon yeah, they might be mates, but this would hurt. Up a break in the 5th.
@NeilMcMahon @JenBrockie @Kimbo_Ramplin @AttardMon rofl
@Mikey_Balboa same. Utterly wrecked
@Kimbo_Ramplin @NeilMcMahon @JenBrockie @AttardMon and Cripes, short price for the French
@Kimbo_Ramplin @NeilMcMahon @JenBrockie @AttardMon they are both so good. Rafa threw the kitchen sink at him.
@AJKennedy89 some asked earlier in the week! I reckon he's gone solo and just released Imagine!
@JenBrockie @NeilMcMahon @Kimbo_Ramplin @AttardMon nerves, completely shredded
What a classic. What two great players. Oh damn. Amazing #AusOpen
Put down your glasses. Greatest of all-time #AusOpen
@NeilMcMahon @AttardMon @Kimbo_Ramplin see you in a few hours! Can't see Fed winning, but then I picked him to lose in the 3rd round!
@FJKeany thanks Frank!
If? https://t.co/Sd8ttOx7rh
@scott_thewspot @DamienCWalker rofl
@DamienCWalker thanks!
@DamienCWalker had a quick google - NY Times uses Williamses
@DamienCWalker Yeah, it should be Williamses
A break from economics today. Federer and Nadal - the last chance to see. #ausopen https://t.co/D7xHYlFyX4
Profiles in cowardice https://t.co/EIU8sb0p8z
Literally no one is saying it is https://t.co/Eoz2b4Mjnu
@BenPhillips_ANU and then there was Sampras...
@BenPhillips_ANU it was.
@BenPhillips_ANU have you read his autobio?
@Fleahbag @Kimbo_Ramplin she played in an era with bugger-all depth and where you'd win a slam playing 5 matches.
@BenPhillips_ANU She was the best (but Serena is better)
@Fleahbag @Kimbo_Ramplin look at the field in the 1971 Aus Open - comparable to now do you think? https://t.co/s80dGtLIdE
@allsumnull but gosh what a slice backhand - also for the time and speed of courts it was a weapon - esp at Wimbledon
@BenPhillips_ANU the absence of Seles for a number of years, and the longevity of Serena gives her the edge
@NickWelch51 @Kimbo_Ramplin put it this way, I'd prefer the second show court to be the Evonne Goolagong Arena .
@MrStevenRaeburn I think of late the quality of opposition has not been great - a pity Henin did stay longer
@Kimbo_Ramplin not even in the discussion with Martina, Steffi, Evert, Serena, Seles IMO
@arwon yeah, Serena got good, quickly
@arwon no "about" it
Speaking as a massive Steffi Graf fan, to argue Serena is not the greatest of all-time requires indulging in a lot of make believe #ausopen
